info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Fort Recovery to near Pennville. Movement was south at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. Brief funnel clouds are possible.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Portland, Westchester, Center, Bryant, Salamonia, Trinity, Brice, Como, Bellfountain, College Corner, Boundary City, Liber, Blaine, Collett, New Corydon, Bluff Point, Powers, and New Mount Pleasant.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Weak, brief funnel clouds are possible. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
